definitions.definition: So as to lessen quantity, level or intensity.

definitions.definition: So as to reduce size, weight or volume.

definitions.definition: From less to greater detail.

definitions.definition: So as to secure or compress something to the floor, ground, or other (usually horizontal) surface.

definitions.definition: (intensifier) Used with verbs to add emphasis to the action of the verb.

definitions.definition: Used with verbs to indicate that the action of the verb was carried to some state of completion, rather than being of indefinite duration.
definitions.example: He boiled the mixture. / He boiled down the mixture.

definitions.definition: From nouth to south of.

definitions.definition: From one end to another of (in any direction); along.

definitions.definition: (especially southern England) A hill, especially a chalk hill; rolling grassland

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) A field, especially one used for horse racing.

The soft hair of the face when beginning to appear.
That which is made of down, as a bed or pillow; that which affords ease and repose, like a bed of down.

A loud, emphatic, exclamation of extreme emotion, especially horror, fear, excitement, or anger; it may comprise a word or a sustained, high-pitched vowel sound.
A form of singing associated with the metal and screamo styles of music. It is a loud, rough, distorted version of the voice; rather than the normal voice of the singer.
Used as an intensifier

definitions.definition: (printers' slang) exclamation mark
To cry out with a shrill voice; to utter a sudden, sharp outcry, or shrill, loud cry, as in fright or extreme pain; to shriek; to screech.
To move quickly; to race.

definitions.definition: To be very indicative of; clearly having the characteristics of.

definitions.definition: The digit or figure 6.
(by ellipsis of six o'clock) Rear, behind (rear side of something).

Describing a group or set with six elements.

The rate of interest charged in discounting.
(transactional analysis) The act of one who believes, or act as though they believe, that their own feelings are more important than the reality of a situation.
To deduct from an account, debt, charge, and the like.

definitions.definition: To lend money upon, deducting the discount or allowance for interest

definitions.definition: To take into consideration beforehand; to anticipate and form conclusions concerning (an event).
To leave out of account or regard as unimportant.

definitions.definition: To lend, or make a practice of lending, money, abating the discount

definitions.definition: (possibly archaic) to sell at a given price.

definitions.definition: To formally accuse (a person) of a crime.

definitions.definition: To impute or ascribe
To call to account; to challenge
To place a burden or load on or in
To load equipment with material required for its use, as a firearm with powder, a fire hose with water, a chemical reactor with raw materials

definitions.definition: To move forward quickly and forcefully, particularly in combat and/or on horseback
(of a hunting dog) to lie on the belly and be still (A command given by a hunter to a dog)
Distant; remote in space.

definitions.definition: Remote in time.

More remote of two.

definitions.definition: Extreme, as a difference in nature or quality.

definitions.definition: Unvoiced

definitions.definition: Far, extreme.
